I'm following up on the following Pennsylvania Right to Know Act request, copied below, and originally submitted on July 30, 2024. You had previously indicated that it would be completed on Aug. 12, 2024. I wanted to check on the status of my request, and to see if there was a new estimated completion date.

Thanks for your help, and let me know if further clarification is needed.

communications.subject: RE: Pennsylvania Right to Know Act Request: Policy Documents
communications.communication:
Please be advised that I did not indicate that the requested records would be available on 8/12/24.  I advised that the Chief of Police was on vacation and would return on 8/12/24.  I also stated in my email that you should consider this the Township’s 30 day notice.  The Chief is currently working his way through the documents to determine whether or not data must be redacted..  Upon completion, he will provide the documents.

Rebecca
Rebecca Vargo

110 Peffer Road
Turtle Creek, PA 15145

title: University of California Berkeley PRA Databases

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: University of California Berkeley PRA Databases
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

1 — any databases and/or spreadsheets used to track requests under the California Public Records Act for the last 5 years from the date of this request.
2 — any and all policy documents, manuals, memos and/or reports regarding the processing of public records requests for the last 5 years from the date of this request.

In the regard to the database requested in paragraph 1, please provide the database in its original electronic format pursuant to Cal. Gov. Code § 6253.9.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Ed Burton

communications.subject: PRA Request: PRA Database
communications.communication:
Dear Mr. Burton:

This is to acknowledge and respond to your California Public Records Act
(CPRA) request below. Attached are the currently outstanding requests. We
do not have a database/spreadsheet or policy/manual.

We redacted information regarding individuals to protect their privacy
pursuant to the Family Educational Rights and Privacy Act (FERPA) (20
U.S.C. 1232g) and Government Code Section 7927.700, which permits the
withholding of “personnel, medical, or similar files, the disclosure of
which would constitute an unwarranted invasion of personal privacy.” In
this case,  personal email addresses, and telephone numbers, as well as
student names, email addresses, and telephone numbers have been redacted.

Regards,

Janesa Shearer
Assistant Public Records Coordinator
************************************
Public Records Office
University of California, Berkeley
California Relay Service 711
<https://hamiltonrelay.com/california/how-it-works/tty-text-telephone.html>

communications.subject: Illinois Freedom of Information Act. Request: Community Watchers, CPS
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records:

In 23-0726-PR11, AUTHORIZE THE FIRST RENEWAL AGREEMENT WITH VARIOUS VENDORS TO PROVIDE SAFE PASSAGE SERVICES FOR DESIGNATED NEIGHBORHOODS, the contract stipulates that Community Watchers will do the following:

"Submitting a daily electronic incident report as well as a weekly electronic report that will include the number and description of incidents, responses to incidents, a list and description of troubled buildings, and an explanation of potential conflicts the Community Watchers suspect will occur in the near future..."

1. Provide all reports submitted by Community Watchers that are employed by Brighton Park Neighborhood Council;
2. Provide all reports submitted by Community Watchers that are employed by SGA Youth and Family Services;
3. Provide all reports submitted by Community Watchers that are employed by St. Sabina Church;

Provide these reports for the week of May 20, 2024 - May 24, 2024.

Because this request is in the public interest for Illinois nonprofit The FOIA Bakery’s work to advocate for public education, please waive any fees in accordance with 5 ILCS § 140/6(c). Feel free to contact me with any questions, or if clarification is needed.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Miriam Bhimani

Upload documents directly: https://accounts.muckrock.com/accounts/login/?next=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.muckrock.com%2Faccounts%2Flogin%2F%3Fnext%3D%252Faccounts%252Fagency_login%252Fchicago-public-schools-3121%252Fcommunity-watchers-cps-170648%252F%253F&url_auth_token=AAATZ6_n4zL9LUQrOAhSu0BQ7O8%3A1sZLJb%3A34gBMCVDDCSgIF_5GjlXCiwrWvKpRcnlZvEpbvSFZpc 
 
Chicago Public Schools (CPS) responds to all public records requests in accordance with the Illinois Freedom of Information Act (FOIA), 5 ILCS 140/1 et seq. 
Due to the volume and complexity of requests received in the normal course of business, CPS is extending the time for its initial response to your request by an additional 5 business days (to 10 business days total beginning on the first business day following receipt of the request) pursuant to 5 ILCS 140/3(e)(v) which allows for the examination and evaluation of the requested records by personnel to determine if they are exempt from disclosure under Section 7 of Illinois FOIA or should be revealed only with appropriate deletions. 
Upon the completion of a response, CPS will provide the first 50 pages to you at no charge.  If a response is more than 50 pages, a fee of 15¢ per page will be charged for each additional page. Copies of video recordings have a fee of $48. All applicable fees must be paid prior to the copying. CPS will inform you of any fees due if your paper response exceeds 50 pages. You can monitor the progress of your request at the link below and you’ll receive an email when your request has been completed. Thank you for using the CPS FOIA Center.

communications.subject: New Message :: R000113-112023
communications.communication:
--- Please respond above this line --- 

RE: FOIL Records Request of November 20, 2023, Reference # R000113-112023 
Dear e, 
This message acknowledges receipt of your request for records under the Freedom of Information Law received by Division of Homeland Security and Emergency Services on November 20, 2023. The request was for: “A copy of all documents, including but not limited to, applications, agreements, and reporting documents for the distribution of the 2023 Urban Area Security Initiative grants.” 
In order to process your request, we require additional clarification. Given the breadth of potentially responsive records and the extensive time that may be needed to review them, are there specific municipalities or agencies whose records you are specifically seeking? Or is there a specific type of information or record you are more narrowly interested in, rather than all documents? 
Upon receiving clarification, your request will be forwarded to the appropriate program area(s) to identify documents that are responsive to your request and which may be made available pursuant to all applicable provisions of the Freedom of Information Law. If we do not receive clarification within 30 days, we will presume that your request is withdrawn. 
Please note that, pursuant to Article 6 of the Public Officers Law, a charge may be applied to your request, including the actual cost of the medium used to respond to your Freedom of Information Law request and/or other related costs. When responsive records have been identified, you will be informed of any cost and how payment should be made. 
Sincerely, 
NYS Division of Homeland Security and Emergency Services To monitor the progress or update this request please log into the FOIL Records Access Center. (https://u8387778.ct.sendgrid.net/ls/click?upn=6HtRfOYLt5fXvpttM-2FU1HTwyZ1szSxJlnArLnBakfSe3jlKWCLNkbKjznkkne-2FyVoZ0Fbp-2F8STjTvxGiKzjBjw-3D-3D8Rmb_w4trWz1erIwnwSnji5355Z12dwaasNzBiwiIfcg1ILIWBOmGvK4flB31F77B-2Bu1hGCZlLxiMGApNlNznqMsqDzYaelzFeS-2FCeXmT2JpW7W8siXlW3KR3BK62nqeJrLQ8oALvbxnGpiByvV9bLD18tOgBVa47XKA3MN7CG-2Ftrn4r20SbgS8D3QPrVm5tHdm4YdxKIPhPaT-2BogW0BGjX0XhUXfS0N9Dwquu4vb-2B9QhDb9WOBmzqB7jmQgRa0R0gKdu-2F-2FqmNlaqfRe0-2Fe3Dx2e2ow3pjfsLxTS4YWpfEkY6-2FHbkT7-2FmFQArfdAM9ifAHvaSFlu9TYBJKTUOSNwG93mTPlgmUHV-2FcWU3mqiszxesPPZluG83kMVkw6-2F-2F9tIYY85i)

May I amend my request to the following?

To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

A copy of all applications for the distribution of the 2023 Urban Area Security Initiative grants.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

RE: FOIL Records Request of November 20, 2023, Reference # R000113-112023 
Dear e, 
This letter is regarding your request for records under the Freedom of Information Law received by Division of Homeland Security and Emergency Services on November 20, 2023 and modified on November 29, 2023. The request was for: “A copy of all applications for the distribution of the 2023 Urban Area Security Initiative grants.” 
We require additional time to process your request for the following reason(s): 
 
  * Due to the volume of requests for records under the Freedom of Information Law by this agency, we need additional time to respond to your request. 
  * We are still conducting a diligent search for responsive records. 
  * Records that have been identified as potentially responsive to your request are currently under review for applicable exemptions, legal privileges and responsiveness.

(https://u8387778.ct.sendgrid.net/ls/click?upn=u001.VEsWrlMiJDg0mXafq1mEXX95BxuYZMPoDu-2F6JePNVQ3KUunGjqMsjrqjhVffuoRv7LnHwvw0EyRzYpsjkN4J5w-3D-3DhE5e_nDo73bEJ9iak7K-2BntbhAXSNF4dFgtV-2BSkNmst0PS6789wvE68e-2BduBxmZDj4OcTqlo6KthR0FrVRsMsR8BJDVzRZ-2B4MUgQkXn2PhwOTGWGqdRJyc8gyt35d-2FL9fVwu4P3Ba-2FsJTaKMuR0etSSn2L6gEpWZn6BsKhRbSzn-2FQ3yNsqdpFpxiQbyE7cmeT5bH8ho9zDOVKfCwZE3K-2FddIjxPVYu-2FECctON8ehVwlzyDYqzmJaA34-2BkWsN564CrbIODG0a18d9SCT-2FrHY48OfUVa4ftgmkKr7bToVznIZ3h-2FqEeEoBPLI0F-2BIef-2FjVUttYe6-2FrSIZcfwZMfZKW7IljmubHuGCfHoH8UPm1uLk0cwg1NXXcNCw-2FW-2B1bz30TJEQ5Vk)

Division of Homeland Security and Emergency Services

communications.subject: Illinois Freedom of Information Act. Request: General Counsel Emails, CPS
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records:

Provide email contents for Ruchi Verma with the following conditions:

1. Emails to/from Ruchi Verma on August 12, 2024 between 6am am and 1 pm;

Please search all CPS email accounts as well as personal accounts used for public business.  Include sender, recipient(s), date and time, subject line, body and if there is an attachment. I am not seeking full attachments at this time. I am also not seeking personal information related to students that is covered under FERPA and ISSRA.

Because this request is in the public interest for Illinois nonprofit The FOIA Bakery’s work to advocate for public education, please waive any fees in accordance with 5 ILCS § 140/6(c). Feel free to contact me with any questions, or if clarification is needed.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Miriam Bhimani

Chicago Public Schools (CPS) responds to all public records requests in accordance with the Illinois Freedom of Information Act (FOIA), 5 ILCS 140/1 et seq. 
Due to the volume and complexity of requests received in the normal course of business, CPS is extending the time for its initial response to your request by an additional 5 business days (to 10 business days total beginning on the first business day following receipt of the request) pursuant to 5 ILCS 140/3(e)(v) which allows for the examination and evaluation of the requested records by personnel to determine if they are exempt from disclosure under Section 7 of Illinois FOIA or should be revealed only with appropriate deletions. 
Upon the completion of a response, CPS will provide the first 50 pages to you at no charge.  If a response is more than 50 pages, a fee of 15¢ per page will be charged for each additional page. Copies of video recordings have a fee of $48. All applicable fees must be paid prior to the copying. CPS will inform you of any fees due if your paper response exceeds 50 pages. You can monitor the progress of your request at the link below and you’ll receive an email when your request has been completed. Thank you for using the CPS FOIA Center. 

Track the issue status and respond at: https://cps.mycusthelp.com/WEBAPP//_rs/RequestEdit.aspx?rid=15984

communications.communication:
--- Please respond above this line --- 
08/29/2024 
Miriam Bhimani 
Dear Miriam Bhimani: 
RE: Chicago Public Schools FOIA Request N015984-081224 
Thank you for using the Chicago Public Schools FOIA Center. You requested the following: 
To Whom It May Concern: 

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records: 

Provide email contents for Ruchi Verma with the following conditions: 

1. Emails to/from Ruchi Verma on August 12, 2024 between 6am am and 1 pm; 

Please search all CPS email accounts as well as personal accounts used for public business. Include sender, recipient(s), date and time, subject line, body and if there is an attachment. I am not seeking full attachments at this time. I am also not seeking personal information related to students that is covered under FERPA and ISSRA. 

Because this request is in the public interest for Illinois nonprofit The FOIA Bakery’s work to advocate for public education, please waive any fees in accordance with 5 ILCS § 140/6(c). Feel free to contact me with any questions, or if clarification is needed. 

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes. 

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not. 

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires. 

Sincerely, 

Miriam Bhimani 

Upload documents directly: https://accounts.muckrock.com/accounts/login/?next=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.muckrock.com%2Faccounts%2Flogin%2F%3Fnext%3D%252Faccounts%252Fagency_login%252Fchicago-public-schools-3121%252Fgeneral-counsel-emails-cps-171763%252F%253F&url_auth_token=AAATZ6_n4zL9LUQrOAhjhvQ7O8%3A1sdhVE%3AJCbzb2F9wC7sUFHuoUw9qnkJbcCR7vPVk6l7xnPXZb0 
RESPONSE: Documents responsive to your request are available to download via the CPS FOIA Center at www.cps.edu/FOIARequests . Please log in with your username and password to access the records. Please note that certain private information was redacted pursuant to 5 ILCS 140/7. Specifically, section 7(1)(b) which exempts certain private information as defined by section 2(c-5) and section 7(1)(c) which exempts personal information contained within public records, the disclosure of which would constitute a clearly unwarranted invasion of personal privacy, unless the disclosure is consented to in writing by the individual subject of the information. “Unwarranted invasion of personal privacy” means the disclosure of information that is highly personal or objectionable to a reasonable person and in which the subject’s right to privacy outweighs any legitimate public interest in obtaining the information. Section 7(1)(f) exempts from release “Preliminary drafts, notes, recommendations, memoranda and other records in which opinions are expressed, or policies or actions are formulated, except that a specific record or relevant portion of a record shall not be exempt when the record is publicly cited and identified by the head of the public body.” [5 ILCS 140/7 (1)(f)]. Student information has been redacted pursuant to 5 ILCS 140/7.5 (r) which exempts from inspection or copying information prohibited from being disclosed by the Illinois School Student Records Act (ISSRA). ISSRA generally prohibits the disclosure of “school student records” and defines a “school student record” as “any writing or other recorded information concerning a student and by which a student may be individually identified, maintained by a school or at is direction or by an employee of a school, regardless of how or where the information is stored.” (105 ILCS 10/2(d). Materials subject to attorney-client privilege and work-product privilege have been redacted pursuant to 5 ILCS 140/7(1)(m) which exempts communications between a public body and an attorney representing the public body that would not be subject to discovery in litigation, and materials prepared or compiled by or for a public body in anticipation of a criminal, civil or administrative proceeding upon the request of an attorney advising the public body. 
You have a right to have the denial of your request reviewed by the Public Access Counselor (PAC) at the Office of the Illinois Attorney General. 5 ILCS 140/9.5(a). You can file your Request for Review with the PAC by writing to: Leah Bartelt; Public Access Counselor Office of the Attorney General 500 South 2nd Street Springfield, Illinois 62706 E-mail: public.access@ilag.gov 877-299-3642 You also have the right to seek judicial review of your denial by filing a lawsuit in the State circuit court. 5 ILCS 140/11. If you choose to file a Request for Review with the PAC, you must do so within 60 calendar days of the date of this denial letter. 5 ILCS 140/9.5(a). Please note that you must include a copy of your original FOIA request and this denial letter when filing a Request for Review with the PAC. Sincerely, Patricia Majchrowicz Freedom of Information Act Officer Chicago Public Schools

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Request: October Surprise
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

This is a request under the Freedom of Information Act.  I hereby request the following records:

All materials relating to the alleged October Surprise plot to influence the outcome of the 1980 United States presidential election, including but not limited to materials gathered for and materials given to the House and Senate investigations.

In addition to a manual search reasonably calculated to locate those materials, please conduct a search of the Central Records System, including but not limited to the Electronic Surveillance (ELSUR) Indices, the Microphone Surveillance (MISUR) Indices, the Physical Surveillance (FISUR) Indices, and the Technical Surveillance (TESUR) Indices, for both main-file records and cross-reference records. Please include a cross-reference search for all individuals associated with the allegations and investigations, including those individuals who testified or wrote about it.

I am a member of the news media and request classification as such. I have previously written about the Bureau for AND Magazine, MuckRock and Glomar Disclosure. My articles have been widely read, with some reaching over 100,000 readers. As such, as I have a reasonable expectation of publication and my editorial and writing skills are well established.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.


Sincerely,

Michael Best

communications.subject: RE: Freedom of Information Request: October Surprise
communications.communication:
Dear Mr. Best,

The FBI has received your Freedom of Information Act/Privacy (FOIPA) request and it will be forwarded to Initial Processing for review.   Your request will be processed under the provisions of FOIPA and a response will be mailed to you at a later date.

Requests for fee waivers and expedited processing will be addressed once your request has been assigned an FOIPA request number. You will receive written notification of the FBI's decision.

Information regarding the Freedom of Information Act/Privacy is available at https://www.fbi.gov<http://www.fbi.gov>/, by clicking on the SERVICES link at the top of the homepage and then click on the Freedom of Information Act/Privacy picture, or the direct link is: https://www.fbi.gov/services/records-management/foia, or by accessing the U. S. Department of Justice at https://www.justice.gov/oip.  If you require additional assistance please contact us at foipaquestions@ic.fbi.gov.

Thank you,



David P. Sobonya
Public Information Officer/GIS
Record/Information Dissemination Section (RIDS)
FBI-Records Management Division
170 Marcel Drive, Winchester, VA  22602-4843
Ofc:  (540) 868-4593
Direct: (540) 868-4286
Fax: (540) 868-4391/4997

The FBI's FOIPA Program is searching the FBI's indices for potentially responsive documents.

You may be contacted via formal letter for all fees and/or negotiation issues that may apply.
NOTE: Recent requests are entered into the FOIPA database in the order that they are received. Before you can check the status, you must have received correspondence assigning a FOIPA request number and the information transferred to the online database. Status information is updated weekly. If a request has been closed within the last six months the online database will display the following: The FOIPA number entered has been closed, and appropriate correspondence has been sent to the address on file.

Estimated Dates of Completion

Requests are processed in the order in which they are received through our multi-track processing system, and the FBI receives a voluminous amount of requests on a daily, weekly, monthly, and annual basis.  Requests are divided into two primary tracks--simple (under 50 pages of potentially responsive documents) and complex (over 50 pages of potentially responsive documents).  Our complex requests are further divided into medium, large, and extra-large sub-tracks.  Simple track requests typically require the least amount of time to process.



Currently, simple track cases average approximately 181 days from the date of receipt for processing.  Requests in the medium processing track are currently averaging 232 days from the date of receipt for processing, those in the large processing track are currently averaging approximately 659 days, and those in the extra-large track are averaging 998 days.

communications.subject: RE: Freedom of Information Request #1360796-000
communications.communication:
Dear Mr. Best,



Please check the status of your FOIPA Request at https://vault.fbi.gov/fdps-1/@@search-fdps, and follow the instructions below.



Check the Status of Your FOIPA Request

If your FOIPA Number is [1195846-0] please enter [1195846-000] into the system. If your FOIPA Number is [1195846-1] please enter [1195846-001] into the system. If you have any questions about the status of your FOIPA request, please e-mail foipaquestions@ic.fbi.gov<mailto:foipaquestions@ic.fbi.gov>.



FIND STATUS OF FOIPA- LAST UPDATED ON February 8, 2017



Please enter the whole FOIPA number-Example: [1234567-000]



FOIPA:

Results will show the Request Number, Case Type and Process Description shown below:

FOIPA:

1234567-000

Case Type:

FOIPA

Process Description (Will display the current progress of the request)

The FBI's FOIPA Program is searching the FBI's indices for potentially responsive documents.

You may be contacted via formal letter for all fees and/or negotiation issues that may apply.
NOTE: Recent requests are entered into the FOIPA database in the order that they are received. Before you can check the status, you must have received correspondence assigning a FOIPA request number and the information transferred to the online database. Status information is updated weekly. If a request has been closed within the last six months the online database will display the following: The FOIPA number entered has been closed, and appropriate correspondence has been sent to the address on file.

Estimated Dates of Completion

Requests are processed in the order in which they are received through our multi-track processing system, and the FBI receives a voluminous amount of requests on a daily, weekly, monthly, and annual basis.  Requests are divided into two primary tracks--simple (under 50 pages of potentially responsive documents) and complex (over 50 pages of potentially responsive documents).  Our complex requests are further divided into medium, large, and extra-large sub-tracks.  Simple track requests typically require the least amount of time to process.



Currently, simple track cases average approximately 181 days from the date of receipt for processing.  Requests in the medium processing track are currently averaging 232 days from the date of receipt for processing, those in the large processing track are currently averaging approximately 659 days, and those in the extra-large track are averaging 998 days.


Thank you,


Holly Early
Government Information Specialist
Record/Information Dissemination Section (RIDS)
FBI-Records Management Division
170 Marcel Drive, Winchester, VA 22602-4843

Direct: (540) 868-4854
Fax: (540) 868-4391 or (450)868-4997
Questions E-mail: foipaquestions@ic.fbi.gov<mailto:foipaquestions@ic.fbi.gov>

Do you have further questions about the FOI/PA process? Visit us at http://www.fbi.gov/foia

Please check the status of your request online at https://vault.fbi.gov/fdps-1/@@search-fdps.    Status updates are performed on a weekly basis.

communications.subject: FOIA request #1360796-000
communications.communication:
Good afternoon Ms. Best,

Reference is made to your Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) request #1360796-000 for FBI records concerning October Surprise.  The FBI has located approximately 3,404 pages that are potentially responsive to your request.  Once requests go over a certain size, usually in the 50-100 page range, they become increasingly complex, greatly slowing down the time required for processing.  Generally the larger the file, the longer it takes to process.  Given our current workload and staffing levels, it may be a very long time before you would begin to receive material from this request.

We contact requesters with requests of this size to see if there might be a way to possibly narrow the scope.  Is this something you might be willing to consider?  If so, please contact me and we can discuss this possibility.  We appreciate your patience and hope to hear from you soon.

Leslie Wilson
540-868-4894
Government Information Specialist
Negotiation/RIDS/RMD
Federal Bureau of Investigation

Leslie,

Unfortunately I'm not sure how to reduce the scope on this in a way that's helpful to everyone. I'm certainly open to suggestions, especially on the more administrative pieces of the file. However, I'm not sure how to describe that in a way that's useful and wouldn't be overly broad. I'm especially hesitant to reduce the scope for this one because it's an overarching file, and its release may eliminate (or reduce the scope of additional materials needed) for related files or the files of people involved in/implicated in the case.

Emma

communications.subject: RE: Freedom of Information Request #1360796-000
communications.communication:
Leslie,

Unfortunately I'm not sure how to reduce the scope on this in a way that's helpful to everyone. I'm certainly open to suggestions, especially on the more administrative pieces of the file. However, I'm not sure how to describe that in a way that's useful and wouldn't be overly broad. I'm especially hesitant to reduce the scope for this one because it's an overarching file, and its release may eliminate (or reduce the scope of additional materials needed) for related files or the files of people involved in/implicated in the case.

Emma

communications.subject: RE: Freedom of Information Request #1360796-000
communications.communication:
Good afternoon Ms. Best,

I have just finished going through the records on the subject of October Surprise.  To focus on the significant file sections on this subject for this request would put a page count at about 900 pages.  I've eliminated the subfiles because the material was duplicative in main file sections.  There appears to be quite a bit of duplication of the documents.  There is a perjury file that was determined not to stick for a couple of persons testifying before the House committee on this subject.  The main file investigation can be addressed by starting with sections until the documents would exceed the medium-track queue.  Some of the material contains articles and congressional handbook material.

Let me know if you are interested in approaching the subject files in a way we can provide the basis of the investigation, overall summary.  This approach is basically to "chip" away at the sections in increments under the 950 threshold.  Some documents may contain other government agency equities and will be processed when guidance is given on the other equity.  The subfiles to eliminate consist of 473 pages, reducing the overall size of your request to under 3,000 pages.

For the medium track processing queue, If sections are processed a few at a time, it will also allow for you to see how exemptions (if applicable) are being used.

Please let me know your thoughts on this.
Sincerely,
Leslie Wilson

files.title: ~WRD000
files.source: Federal Bureau of Investigation

communications.subject: RE: Freedom of Information Request #1360796-000
communications.communication:
Leslie,
It sounds like you're suggesting a rolling release of it? If so, that'd be fine with me.

communications.subject: RE: Freedom of Information Request #1360796-000
communications.communication:
Good afternoon,

If you are interested in reducing the size of your request at this time, I can move forward documents from the file that will fit within the medium-track criteria.  If you still want more materials on the subject, you will have to initiate a new request citing the current FOIA number which helps streamline the process.  Your request can stay in the large track queue and once the request is assigned from the backlog, interim releases will be made it just take a significantly longer time to get materials.

Please let me know if you want your request to be reduced or if you want it processed in whole.

Thanks and sorry for any confusion.

Sincerely,
Leslie Wilson

title: ASU PD - communications data 4/26/24 (Maricopa County Sheriff)

communications.subject: Arizona Public Records Law Request: ASU PD - communications data 4/26/24 (Maricopa County Sheriff)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Arizona Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

- State Trooper badge numbers and camera footage

- ASU communications data

Source: https://www.phoenixnewtimes.com/news/asu-gaza-israel-protest-arrests-18886487 

REQUESTS:

State Troopers

1. A list of all state troopers and their badge numbers who were deployed to the Arizona State University "encampment" on Friday, April 26, 2024 at approximately 11pm. 

2. All body camera footage from all responding state troopers to the Arizona State University "encampment" on Friday, April 26, 2024 at approximately 11pm. 

Arizona State University

1. A copy of all university policies, protocols, and procedures related to emergency management situations that the university used in responding to the "encampment" on Friday, April 26, 2024.

2. Metadata for email communications where Michael Thompson is either the sender, recipient, CC'ed, or BCC'ed, sent between the dates of 4/1/2024 and 5/2/2024 and containing one of the following keywords: "encampment", "protest", "Palestine", and/or "Liberated Zone". Please include any variations that are not case sensitive.

The specific metadata data points I'm interested in are: to address(es), from address, cc address(es), bcc address(es), sent date/time, received date/time, subject line, and names of all attachments. This request does not seek the contents of the emails themselves, and only the specified email metadata. Please do not include duplicate emails. Please provide me with the records in an Excel format.

3. Metadata for email communications where Michael Crow is either the sender, recipient, CC'ed, or BCC'ed, sent between the dates of 4/1/2024 and 5/2/2024 and containing one of the following keywords: "encampment", "protest", "Palestine", and/or "Liberated Zone". Please include any variations that are not case sensitive.

The specific metadata data points I'm interested in are: to address(es), from address, cc address(es), bcc address(es), sent date/time, received date/time, subject line, and names of all attachments. This request does not seek the contents of the emails themselves, and only the specified email metadata. Please do not include duplicate emails. Please provide me with the records in an Excel format.

4. All text or chat messages (including group messages, in any form or application including but not limited to SMS, MMS, WhatsApp, WeChat, Signal, Instagram, Twitter, Facebook, Hangouts, Skype, Teams) sent or received to/cc/bcc/from by Michael Thompson on government or personal accounts from April 1, 2024 and present and containing one of the following keywords: "encampment", "protest", "Palestine", and/or "Liberated Zone". Please include any variations that are not case sensitive.

5. All text or chat messages (including group messages, in any form or application including but not limited to SMS, MMS, WhatsApp, WeChat, Signal, Instagram, Twitter, Facebook, Hangouts, Skype, Teams) sent or received to/cc/bcc/from by Michael Crow on government or personal accounts from April 1, 2024 and present and containing one of the following keywords: "encampment", "protest", "Palestine", and/or "Liberated Zone". Please include any variations that are not case sensitive.

6. Call logs (call time, duration, and number) for all calls to and from phones owned by Arizona State University to any of the law enforcement agencies listed below between April 25th - April 28th:

- Arizona State Troopers

- Maricopa County Sheriff

- Phoenix Police Department

- Tempe Police Department

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Y.E

communications.subject: RE: Arizona Public Records Law Request: ASU PD - communications data 4/26/24 (Maricopa County Sheriff) 2013
communications.communication:
Good morning,

The Maricopa County Sheriff’s Office has received your request for public records and is processing your request. All requests are processed in the order in which they are received, and no requests are prioritized by deadline date. The amount of time to completely process your request depends upon the number of pending requests, volume of material encompassed in the request, and the amount of redaction, if any, that is necessary.

Please be aware, if you are requesting records with large amount of body camera videos and or high-profile cases, the time to complete your request may be significantly longer as these cases are often voluminous. Identifying the specific record(s) being requested may help expedite your request. You will be notified once records are made available for you to download or pick up, or if no records are found. Your tracking # is 2013. When checking the status of your request, please send emails to mediarequest@mcso.maricopa.gov<mailto:mediarequest@mcso.maricopa.gov> and include your tracking # 2013.

***Effective February 1, 2024, pursuant to ARS 39-129, the Maricopa County Sheriff’s Office (MCSO) Legal Liaison Section has implemented a new fee schedule for requests for video recordings.  The fee for processing video recordings is $25 per each video-hour ($6.25 per quarter hour).  In the event there are contemporaneous multiple requests for the same video, the cost associated with processing the video will be shared equally between all requesting parties at that time. Requests for previously processed videos will be at no cost unless the requestor wishes to receive a hard copy instead of an electronic copy. Fees for hardcopies are listed below. ***

The fee breakdown for hard copies are as follows:

Documents:                       $.50 for each page

CD’s:                                      $15.00 each


Thank you,


[cid:image001.png@01DAD2B3.2C4158F0]

Sgt. Monica Bretado
Media Relations
Maricopa County Sheriff’s Office
550 W. Jackson Street, Phoenix, AZ 85003
E-mail : M_Bretado@mcso.maricopa.gov<mailto:M_Bretado@mcso.maricopa.gov>
[cid:image002.jpg@01DAD2B3.2C4158F0]<https://twitter.com/mcsoaz?lang=en> [facebook-icon_32x32] <https://www.facebook.com/MCSOaz>    [cid:image004.png@01DAD2B3.2C4158F0] <https://www.mcso.org/> [instagram] <https://www.instagram.com/mcsoaz/?hl=en> [Facebook] <https://www.facebook.com/mcsoazespanol/>  [cid:image002.jpg@01DAD2B3.2C4158F0] <https://twitter.com/mcsoazespanol>


The information contained in this email and any files transmitted with it are confidential and/or privileged, and are intended solely for the use of the recipients listed above. If you are not the intended recipient, you are hereby notified that any dissemination, distribution or copying of the transmitted information is strictly prohibited. If you have received this transmission in error, please immediately notify the sender and delete and destroy all copies and attachments.

communications.communication:
Good afternoon,

The Maricopa County Sheriff's Office is in receipt of your payment of $6.25, Check #0000012204 for documentation.
Your records are available and can be downloaded HERE<https://mcso.sharefile.com/d-s1c872fe0fa5241b28d8ea0b34742087a> for free for the next ten (10) business days. Once you click on the link you will need to input your name and email address to access the records. The link will automatically expire in 10 business days and files are deleted. If you fail to download these files, you will need to resubmit a new request to obtain copies. If you would like a hard copy, please respond to this email and an appointment will be set up for purchasing.

Below is the process and fee associated with requesting hard copies.

Hard copies will be available only by appointments only. Monday through Friday from 9 a.m. to 4 p.m., excluding holidays.  Your records will be available for review or purchase for the next 30 business days from the date of this notice. A price will be provided if you choose to receive hard copies.

Your records can be picked up at the Sheriff's Office headquarters at 550 W. Jackson, Phoenix AZ 85003. By appointment only.

Date of release: 08/29/2024
Subject of your request: Documents relating to ASU Encampment
Items released:
*              Body Worn Camera MC24066950

Please be advised that you may want to contact the Department of Public Safety and ASU Police Department in reference to the other records requested.

The fee breakdown for hard copies are as follows:

Documents:                       $.50 for each page

CD's:                                      $15.00 each

*Please Note: Documents are available for 30 business days from the date of this notice to be picked up and/or reviewed.  After 30 business days has elapsed, the request will be closed, and the documents destroyed.  In order to obtain requested documents after the 30 business days, a new public records request will have to be resubmitted and reprocessed.  All requests are handled in the order they are received. Providing this response will close out this request. Thank you

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Minnesota Government Data Practices Act, I hereby request the following records:

Police regards regarding the October 13th, 2007 suicide of Garry Michael Kreibich at 806 Redwood West in La Crescent, MN

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Jill Torgerson

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Diplomatic Intercepts - Ecuador
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

A copy of FBI file 65-HQ-42520 (or 65-HQ-43520), on the interception of diplomatic communications from the Ecuadorian government during World War II.

Please conduct a search of the Central Records System and the Alexandria Records Center, including but not limited to the Electronic Surveillance (ELSUR) Indices, the Microphone Surveillance (MISUR) Indices, the Physical Surveillance (FISUR) Indices, and the Technical Surveillance (TESUR) Indices, for both main-file records and cross-reference records for all relevant names, individuals, agencies and companies. If any potentially responsive records have been destroyed and/or transferred to NARA, then I request copies of the destruction or transfer slips as well as any other documentation relating to, mentioning or describing said transfer or destruction, to include but not be limited to confirmation that the Bureau has no other copies of said records. If previously released records are available, then I request a rolling release consisting of those records while additional records are located and processed for release.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Paul Galante

communications.communication:
# Individual Information

Prefix First Name Middle Name Last Name Suffix Email Phone Location

# Domestic Address

Address Line 1 Address Line 2 City State Postal

# Agreement to Pay

How you will pay

I am limiting my request to the free two hours of searching and 100 duplicated
pages. I am not willing to pay additional fees.

# Non-Individual FOIA Request

Request Information

    
    
    To Whom It May Concern:
    
    Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following
    records:
    
    A copy of FBI file 65-HQ-42520 (or 65-HQ-43520), on the interception of
    diplomatic communications from the Ecuadorian government during World War
    II.
    
    Please conduct a search of the Central Records System and the Alexandria
    Records Center, including but not limited to the Electronic Surveillance
    (ELSUR) Indices, the Microphone Surveillance (MISUR) Indices, the Physical
    Surveillance (FISUR) Indices, and the Technical Surveillance (TESUR)
    Indices, for both main-file records and cross-reference records for all
    relevant names, individuals, agencies and companies. If any potentially
    responsive records have been destroyed and/or transferred to NARA, then I
    request copies of the destruction or transfer slips as well as any other
    documentation relating to, mentioning or describing said transfer or
    destruction, to include but not be limited to confirmation that the Bureau
    has no other copies of said records. If previously released records are
    available, then I request a rolling release consisting of those records
    while additional records are located and processed for release.
    
    The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and
    this request is not being made for commercial purposes.
    
    In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me
    of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the
    request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM
    if not.
    
    Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look
    forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days,
    as the statute requires.
    
    Sincerely,
    
    Paul Galante
    
    Upload documents directly:
    https://accounts.muckrock.com/accounts/login/?next=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.muckrock.com%2Faccounts%2Flogin%2F%3Fnext%3D%252Faccounts%252Fagency_login%252Ffederal-bureau-of-investigation-10%252Fdiplomatic-intercepts-ecuador-117024%252F%253Femail%253Defoia%252540subscriptions.fbi.gov&url_auth_token=AAAj2DhBAMB3M81TmD2Oe8C8-1M%3A1mAPuy%3AWplzRErcGzyM-HKUEtCT2A6GRis

** 

Please be advised that efoia@subscriptions.fbi.gov is a no-reply email
address. Questions regarding your FOIA request may be directed to
foipaquestions@fbi.gov. If you have received a FOIPA request number, please
include this in all correspondence concerning your request. Please note eFOIPA
requests are processed in the order that they are received. If you have not
received a FOIPA request number, your request is in the process of being
opened at which time it will be assigned a FOIPA request number and
correspondence will be forthcoming.

** 

Upon receipt of your FOIPA request number, you may check the status of your
FOIPA request on the FBI’s electronic FOIA Library (The Vault) on the FBI’s
public website, http://vault.fbi.gov by clicking on the ‘Check Status of Your
FOI/PA Request tool’ link. Status updates are performed on a weekly basis. If
you receive a comment that your FOIPA request number was not located in the
database, please check back at a later date.

communications.subject: RE: Freedom of Information Act Request #1502013-000
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

I wanted to follow up on the following Freedom of Information Act request, copied below, and originally submitted on Aug. 1, 2021. Please let me know when I can expect to receive a response.  You had assigned it reference number #1502013-000.

Thanks for your help, and let me know if further clarification is needed.

communications.subject: RE: [EXTERNAL EMAIL] -  RE: Freedom of Information Act Request #1502013-000
communications.communication:
Thank you for contacting foipaquestions@fbi.gov.  Please check the status of your FOIPA Request at http://vault.fbi.gov by clicking on "Check Status of Your FOI/PA Request" on the right side of the page, and follow the instructions below.

Check the Status of Your FOIPA Request
If your FOIPA Number is [1234567-0] please enter [1234567-000] into the system. If your FOIPA Number is [1234567-1] please enter [1234567-001] into the system. If you have any questions about the status of your FOIPA request, please e-mail foipaquestions@fbi.gov.

FIND STATUS OF FOIPA- Request statuses are updated weekly

Please enter the whole FOIPA number-Example: [1234567-000]

FOIPA:
Results will show the Request Number, Case Type and Process Description shown below:
FOIPA:
1234567-000

Case Type:
FOIPA

Process Description (Will display the current progress of the request)
The FBI's FOIPA Program is searching the FBI's indices for potentially responsive documents.
You may be contacted via formal letter for all fees and/or negotiation issues that may apply.

NOTE: Recent requests are entered into the FOIPA database in the order that they are received. Before you can check the status, you must have received correspondence assigning a FOIPA request number and the information transferred to the online database. Status information is updated weekly. If a request has been closed within the last six months the online database will display the following: The FOIPA number entered has been closed, and appropriate correspondence has been sent to the address on file.

Estimated Dates of Completion
Requests are processed in the order in which they are received through our multi-track processing system.  Requests are divided into two primary tracks--simple (under 50 pages of potentially responsive documents) and complex (over 50 pages of potentially responsive documents).  Complex requests are further divided into medium, large, and extra-large sub-tracks based upon request size.  Simple track requests typically require the least amount of time to process.  Currently, simple track cases average approximately 152 days from the date of receipt for processing.  Our complex requests in the medium processing track are currently averaging 922 days, large processing track are currently averaging approximately 1,964 days, and extra-large processing track are currently averaging 2,360 days for processing.

Respectfully,

Public Information Officer
FBI - Information Management Division
200 Constitution Drive
Winchester, VA  22602
O: (540) 868-4593
E: foipaquestions@fbi.gov<mailto:foipaquestions@fbi.gov>

Do you have further questions about the FOI/PA process? Visit us at http://www.fbi.gov/foia

Please check the status of your request online at https://vault.fbi.gov/fdps-1/@@search-fdps    Status updates are performed on a weekly basis.

Note:  This is a non-emergency email address.  If this is an emergency, please call 911 directly.  If you need to report a tip for immediate action, please contact FBI Tips at http://tips.fbi.gov/ or reach out to your local field office.

communications.communication:
Good morning,

Thank you for the email confirmation concerning this request.  We have noted that you are still interested in the potentially responsive documents at this time.

Any future status inquires please go to foipaquestions@fbi.gov<mailto:foipaquestions@fbi.gov>.

Best regards,

Negotiation Team
Federal Bureau of Investigation
Fbi.foipa.negotiation@fbi.gov<mailto:Fbi.foipa.negotiation@fbi.gov>

Status Checks: https://vault.fbi.gov/fdps-1/@@search-fdps | foipaquestions@fbi.gov<mailto:foipaquestions@fbi.gov>
For additional information, please visit the www.fbi.gov/foia<http://www.fbi.gov/foia> website.
